title: Milton Glaser Dylan poster
content:
G'day,  
Does anyone have any recommendations or suggestions for a font similar to that used by Milton Glaser on his iconic and often parodied Dylan poster.

Blue skies

Dean

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [dylan\_poster.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130525050645/http:/typophile.com/files/dylan_poster.jpg) | 36.74 KB |
author: Monkeyboy

comments.content:
As far as I can remember these letters were custom designed by Glaser. He later developed a typeface called "Baby Teeth" based on this lettering. Check out Stephen Coles' post in [this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20130525050645/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37514) for a list of alternates.

- Lex
From what I know Baby Teeth is not available in digital format.

Bebit from Paratype is a pretty faithful reproduction as far as I can tell.

- Lex

_From what I know Baby Teeth is not available in digital format._

That is correct, Christian. As Lex said,

[http://www.paratype.com/pstore/fonts/Bebit.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20130525050645/http:/www.paratype.com/pstore/fonts/Bebit.htm "http://www.paratype.com/pstore/fonts/Bebit.htm")
i think i've seen this font before on dafont.com
